strong.span: Click the links to view the archived COVID-19 Releases from BUHSD:

p.span: We recognize that the school closure and transition to online delivery of learning opportunities due to the COVID-19 pandemic is not something students or teachers chose or had a chance to prepare for prior to it occurring. Students and teachers left for Spring Break anticipating that they would be back on campus after a week to complete the school year with in person classes, spring sports, artistic performances, end of the year celebrations, Prom, and so on. In addition to the stress that having school life changed so abruptly brings, individuals may also be dealing with anxiety from medical concerns related to the spread of COVID-19, family dynamics changing as every member is trying to work and learn from home, financial strains from uncertain employment situations, fear of the unknown, and so forth.

With all of this in mind, and the Governor’s announcement that the closure would be in effect for the remainder of the spring 2020 semester, our goal is to make the most of the next six weeks. We are fortunate as a one-to-one district to have devices given to all students that makes online learning possible. As a District and School Community, we want to provide as much support and opportunity for students as we can during these uncertain times. At this point, students should have connected with their teachers and engaged in review activities that have helped them establish a new school routine online that provides structure that is needed in uncertain times. Moving forward, there is course content that needs to be taught and course competencies that need to be learned in order to prepare students for the coursework and life experiences that will come in future years.

span.strong: Click here for the Stage 2 Learning Opportunities Plan starting on Monday, April 13, 2020.

div.span: BUHSD Meal Services for students 18 & Under

p.span: Additional Meal Services as of March 30, 2020

span.span: To provide a routine for students, teachers will hold office hours at the following times for each class period:

p.span: Professional Learning Community Meeting & Prep Time: 8 to 9:45 am

Period 1: 10 to10:45 am
Period 2: 11 to 11:45 am
Lunch: 11:45 am to 12:15 pm
Period 4/5: 12:15 to 1:00 pm
Period 6: 1:15 to 2:00 pm
Professional Learning Community Meeting & Prep Time: 2:15 to 3:30 pm

div.p:
Buckeye Union High School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability. Click here to read the entire policy.
El Distrito Escolar de Buckeye Union High School no discrimina en base de raza, color, origen nacional, sexo, edad o discapacidad. Haga clic aquí para leer toda la política.
